Package ie.gmit.dip

Class Index

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.gmit.dip.Index
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Indexable
    public class Index
extends java.lang.Object
implements Indexable
    Since:
    1.8 The Index is an implementation of Indexable interface. It represents an index that is used in publishing, e.g. for indexing a book, a document or other text.

    It uses 'heading', 'locator' and 'wordDetails', where: - 'heading' is a word - 'locator' are pointer associated with 'heading', page number or line number - 'wordDetails' are dictionary word definitions associated with 'heading'

    It uses a map of 'heading' and 'locators' (a map of indices) and a map of 'headings' and 'wordDetails' (a map of words definitions).

    A 'locators' is a set of Integers. Integers cannot be duplicated within the same set of 'locators'. It means, that if 'heading' appears more than once in the same location (page or line), it will not be duplicates in an associated set of 'locators'.

    Some methods use a frequency of 'heading'. The frequency of 'heading' is the number of 'locators' (pages or lines) associated with a 'heading'. The frequency is not the total number of times a 'heading' appeared in a document, but the number of 'locators'.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Index()
      Creates a new Index object with an empty map of indices and a map wordDefinitions
      Index​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> indices, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<WordDetails>> wordDefinitions)
      Constructs a new Index object based on a map of indices and map of word definitions passed as arguments.

    • Method Detail

      • addIndex

        public boolean addIndex​(java.lang.String heading,
                        java.lang.Integer locator,
                        java.util.List<WordDetails> wordDetails)
        Big-O notation - O(log(n))

        Returns true if the 'heading' and associated 'locator' and 'wordDetails' was successfully added to the map of indices. If the index already exists in the map, it adds a 'locator' (e.g. page or line) to the corresponding set of 'locators'.

        It returns false if the 'locator' already existed in a associated set of 'locators'.

        Specified by:
        addIndex in interface Indexable
        Parameters:
        heading - a word
        locator - a page number
        wordDetails - word details
        Returns:
        true if the 'heading' and 'locator' was added to the map of indices, true if 'locator' was added to the set of 'locators', otherwise false

      • getIndices

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer>> getIndices()
        Big-O notation - O(n log(n))

        Returns the indices as a map of 'headings' and associated set of 'locators'.

        The returned map may be empty.

        Specified by:
        getIndices in interface Indexable
        Returns:
        a map of 'headings' and associated set of 'locators'

      • getWordDefinitions

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<WordDetails>> getWordDefinitions()
        Big-O notation - O(n log(n))

        Returns the words definitions as a map of 'headings' and an associated list of 'wordDetails'.

        The returned map may be empty.

        Specified by:
        getWordDefinitions in interface Indexable
        Returns:
        a map of words definitions

      • indicesTotal

        public int indicesTotal()
        Big-O notation - O(1)

        Returns a total number of unique 'headings' (words).

        It returns 0 if the map is empty.

        Specified by:
        indicesTotal in interface Indexable
        Returns:
        int a total number of 'headings'

      • sortFrequency

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> sortFrequency​(boolean asc)
        Big-O notation - O(n^2)

        Returns sorted list of 'headings' in an ascending or descending order. The 'headings' with the same frequency are sorted in the alphanumeric ascending order.

        Specified by:
        sortFrequency in interface Indexable
        Parameters:
        asc - sorts ascending if true
        Returns:
        list of 'headings' in the frequency order

      • getXFrequent

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getXFrequent​(int minAmount,
                                                     boolean lessFrequent)
        Big-O notation - O(n)

        Returns list of 'headings' containing the most or less frequent 'headings' (words) in the alphanumeric ascending order.

        The first parameter sets the minimum number of most or less frequent words returned. If there are words with the same frequency, the number of returned words may exceed the minimum number.

        Returns the less frequent 'headings' if the 'lessFrequent' parameter is true. Otherwise returns the most frequent 'headings'.

        Specified by:
        getXFrequent in interface Indexable
        Parameters:
        minAmount - minimum number of returned 'headings'
        lessFrequent - if true it returns the less frequent 'headings'. If false it returns the most frequent 'headings'
        Returns:
        list of the most or less frequent 'headings'

      • getWord

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getWord​(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> words)
        Big-O notation - O(n)

        Returns list of 'headings' containing the searched words.

        Specified by:
        getWord in interface Indexable
        Parameters:
        words - words to be searched for in the map of indices
        Returns:
        list of headings containing the searched words. It may be empty if no words given as an argument were found

      • getWordsWithRegex

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getWordsWithRegex​(java.lang.String regex)
        Big-O notation - O(n)

        Returns list of 'headings' containing the searched words based on a regex passed to the method as an argument.

        Specified by:
        getWordsWithRegex in interface Indexable
        Parameters:
        regex - a regular expression that is used for searching a words in the map of indices
        Returns:
        list of 'headings' containing the searched words. The size may be 0 if no words were found
